summary: This document is an email chain between defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim and prosecutors regarding scheduling the trial for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The defense advocates for a November 8, 2021 trial start date, citing Maxwell's extended detention's negative impact on her health, and suggests greater date flexibility if she is released pending trial.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell, corresponding with prosecutors to schedule the trial and advocating for an earlier start date due to concerns about Maxwell's detention.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). Her defense team cites her extended detention and its negative effect on her health as a reason to start the trial by November 8, 2021.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: A recipient of the email correspondence, involved in the scheduling conference for the trial.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: A defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on the emails. She has a conflicting civil trial scheduled for December 13, 2021.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: A prosecutor copied on one of the scheduling emails.

connections.description: Sternheim is the defense attorney representing Maxwell in the criminal case, advocating for her trial schedule and potential release.
Menninger is a defense attorney on Maxwell's legal team, as indicated by her inclusion in the correspondence.
They are opposing counsel in the case, corresponding professionally to schedule the trial date.
Both are defense attorneys working on Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team, as shown by their coordination on scheduling.

events.title: Proposed Trial Start Date
events.description: The defense team's earliest and preferred date to begin the trial for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Laura Menninger's Civil Trial
events.description: A conflicting civil trial scheduled for defense attorney Laura Menninger, which she will try to move to accommodate the Maxwell trial.

events.title: Defense Letter-Motion Filed
events.description: The defense filed a letter-motion (Docket 246) detailing their position, which is referenced in the scheduling emails.

locations: West 19th Street office (Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim, noted as closed due to Covid-19)
keyFacts: The defense for Ghislaine Maxwell strongly advocated for a November 8, 2021 trial start date, opposing any date 'far beyond' that.
The defense linked their scheduling flexibility to Maxwell's pre-trial release, stating they would have 'greater date flexibility' if she were released pending trial.
The defense cited Maxwell's 'extended period of detention and its deleterious effect on her health and well-being' as a primary reason for wanting an earlier trial.
The correspondence reveals active scheduling negotiations between the prosecution and defense in the lead-up to Maxwell's trial in late 2021.
Defense attorney Laura Menninger had a scheduling conflict with a civil trial set for December 13, 2021.
